Package camzup.core

Class Pixels

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Pixels
public abstract class Pixels
extends java.lang.Object
Holds methods that operate on arrays of pixels held by images.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Pixels.MapLuminance
    Converts a color as a 32 bit integer to a factor to be supplied to a gradient evaluation.

    Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image.

  • Method Details

    • adjustContrast

      public static int[] adjustContrast​(int[] source, float fac, int[] target)
      Adjusts the contrast of colors from a source pixels array by a factor. Uses the CIE LAB color space. The adjustment factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      fac - the contrast factor
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the adjusted pixels
      See Also:
      Utils.clamp(float, float, float), Color.fromHex(int, Color), Color.sRgbaTolRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.lRgbaToXyza(Color, Vec4), Color.xyzaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.labaToXyza(Vec4, Vec4), Color.xyzaTolRgba(Vec4, Color), Color.lRgbaTosRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.toHexIntSat(Color)

    • adjustLch

      public static int[] adjustLch​(int[] source, Vec4 adjust, int[] target)
      Adjusts a source pixels array's colors in CIE LCH. Assigns the results to a target array.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      adjust - the adjustment
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the adjusted pixels
      See Also:
      Vec4.none(Vec4), Vec4.add(Vec4, Vec4, Vec4), Color.fromHex(int, Color), Color.sRgbaTolRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.lRgbaToXyza(Color, Vec4), Color.xyzaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.labaToLcha(Vec4, Vec4), Color.lchaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.labaToXyza(Vec4, Vec4), Color.xyzaTolRgba(Vec4, Color), Color.lRgbaTosRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.toHexIntSat(Color)

    • checker

      public static int[] checker​(int a, int b, int cols, int rows, int w, int h, int[] target)
      Creates a checker pattern in an array of pixels.
      Parameters:
      a - the first color
      b - the second color
      cols - the column count
      rows - the row count
      w - the image width
      h - the image height
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the checker pattern

    • fill

      public static int[] fill​(int c, int[] target)
      Fills the pixels target array with a color. The color is expected to be a 32-bit color integer.
      Parameters:
      c - the fill color
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the filled array

    • filterBilinear

      public static final int filterBilinear​(float xSrc, float ySrc, int wSrc, int hSrc, int[] source)
      Internal helper function to sample a source image with a bilinear color mix. Returns a hexadecimal integer color
      Parameters:
      xSrc - the source x coordinate
      ySrc - the source y coordinate
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      source - the source pixel array
      Returns:
      the color

    • flipX

      public static int[] flipX​(int[] source, int w, int h, int[] target)
      Flips the pixels source array horizontally, on the x axis, and stores the result in the target array.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      w - the image width
      h - the image height
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the flipped pixels

    • flipY

      public static int[] flipY​(int[] source, int w, int h, int[] target)

      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      w - the image width
      h - the image height
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:

    • gradientConic

      public static int[] gradientConic​(Gradient grd, float xOrig, float yOrig, float radians, Color.AbstrEasing easing, int wTrg, int hTrg, int[] target)
      Generates a conic gradient, where the factor rotates on the z axis around an origin point. Best used with square images; for other aspect ratios, the origin should be adjusted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      xOrig - the origin x coordinate
      yOrig - the origin y coordinate
      radians - the angle in radians
      wTrg - the image width
      hTrg - the image height
      easing - the easing function
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the gradient pixels
      See Also:
      Color.toHexIntSat(Color), Gradient.eval(Gradient, float, Color.AbstrEasing, Color), Utils.mod1(float)

    • gradientLinear

      public static int[] gradientLinear​(Gradient grd, float xOrig, float yOrig, float xDest, float yDest, Color.AbstrEasing easing, int wTrg, int hTrg, int[] target)
      Generates a linear gradient from an origin point to a destination point. The origin and destination should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. The scalar projection is clamped to [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      xOrig - the origin x coordinate
      yOrig - the origin y coordinate
      xDest - the destination x coordinate
      yDest - the destination y coordinate
      wTrg - the image width
      hTrg - the image height
      easing - the easing function
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the gradient pixels
      See Also:
      Color.toHexIntSat(Color), Gradient.eval(Gradient, float, Color.AbstrEasing, Color), Utils.max(float, float), Utils.clamp01(float)

    • gradientMap

      public static int[] gradientMap​(int[] source, Gradient grd, Color.AbstrEasing easing, java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Float> map, int[] target)
      Maps the colors of a source pixels array to those of a gradient using a mapping function. The mapping function accepts a pixel as an argument and returns a factor to be given to a gradient evaluation method. Retains the original color's transparency.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      grd - the gradient
      easing - the easing function
      map - the mapping function
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the mapped pixels
      See Also:
      Color.toHexIntSat(Color), Gradient.eval(Gradient, float, Color.AbstrEasing, Color)

    • gradientRadial

      public static int[] gradientRadial​(Gradient grd, float xOrig, float yOrig, float radius, Color.AbstrEasing easing, int wTrg, int hTrg, int[] target)
      Generates a radial gradient from an origin point. The origin should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. Does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that isn't 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      xOrig - the origin x coordinate
      yOrig - the origin y coordinate
      radius - the radius
      wTrg - the image width
      hTrg - the image height
      easing - the easing function
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the gradient pixels
      See Also:
      Color.toHexIntSat(Color), Gradient.eval(Gradient, float, Color.AbstrEasing, Color), Utils.max(float, float)

    • grayscale

      public static int[] grayscale​(int[] source, int[] target)
      Converts a pixels source array to gray, then stores the result in the target array. The result still uses 32-bit integers in ARGB format; the gray value is repeated three times.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the gray pixels
      See Also:
      sRgbLuminance(int)

    • invertLab

      l - invert lightness
      a - invert a

    • lRgbaTosRgba

      public static int lRgbaTosRgba​(int c, boolean adjustAlpha)
      Converts a pixel color from linear RGB to standard RGB. If the adjust alpha flag is true, then alpha is converted as well.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      adjustAlpha - adjust alpha flag
      Returns:
      the standard pixels

    • lRgbaTosRgba

      public static int[] lRgbaTosRgba​(int[] source, boolean adjustAlpha, int[] target)

    • mask

      public static int[] mask​(int[] under, int wUnd, int hUnd, int[] over, int wOvr, int hOvr, int x, int y, Vec2 dim)
      Masks the pixels of an under image with the alpha channel of the over image. Offset coordinates are relative to the top-left corner.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      under - the under image pixels
      wUnd - the under image width
      hUnd - the under image height
      over - the over image pixels
      wOvr - the over image width
      hOvr - the over image height
      x - the x offset
      y - the y offset
      dim - the target dimensions
      Returns:
      the masked pixels

    • mirror

      public static int[] mirror​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float xDest, float yDest, boolean flip, int[] target)
      Mirrors, or reflects, pixels from a source image across the axis described by an origin and destination. Coordinates are expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0]. Out-of-bounds pixels are omitted from the mirror.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      xOrigin - the origin x
      yOrigin - the origin y
      xDest - the destination x
      yDest - the destination y
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the mirrored pixels
      See Also:
      Utils.approx(float, float, float), Utils.round(float), mirrorX(int[], int, int, boolean, int[]), mirrorY(int[], int, int, int, boolean, int[]), filterBilinear(float, float, int, int, int[])

    • mirrorX

      public static int[] mirrorX​(int[] source, int wSrc, int pivot, boolean flip, int[] target)
      Mirrors, or reflects, pixels from a source image across a pivot. The pivot is expected to be in [-1, width + 1].
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      pivot - the x pivot
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the mirrored pixels

    • mirrorY

      public static int[] mirrorY​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, int pivot, boolean flip, int[] target)
      Mirrors, or reflects, pixels from a source image across a pivot. The pivot is expected to be in [-1, height + 1]. The up axis is not mirrored, so positive y points down to the bottom of the image.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      pivot - the y pivot
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the mirrored pixels

    • paletteExtract

      public static Color[] paletteExtract​(int[] source, int capacity, int threshold)
      Extracts a palette from a source pixels array using an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. The threshold describes the minimum number of unique colors in the image beneath which it is preferable to not engage the octree. Once the octree has been used, colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      threshold - the minimum threshold
      Returns:
      the color array
      See Also:
      Bounds3.cieLab(Bounds3), Color.fromHex(int, Color), Color.sRgbaTolRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.lRgbaToXyza(Color, Vec4), Color.xyzaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.labaToXyza(Vec4, Vec4), Color.xyzaTolRgba(Vec4, Color), Color.lRgbaTosRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.clearBlack(Color), Octree.insert(Vec3)

    • paletteMap

      public static int[] paletteMap​(int[] source, Color[] palette, int capacity, float radius, int[] target)
      Applies a palette to an array of pixels using an Octree to find the nearest match in Euclidean space. Retains the original color's transparency.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      palette - the color palette
      capacity - the octree capacity
      radius - the query radius
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the modified pixels
      See Also:
      Bounds3.cieLab(Bounds3), Color.sRgbaTolRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.lRgbaToXyza(Color, Vec4), Color.xyzaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.toHexIntSat(Color), Color.fromHex(int, Color), Octree.insert(Vec3), Octree.cull(), Utils.abs(float), Utils.max(float, float)

    • premul

      public static int[] premul​(int[] source, int[] target)
      Multiplies the red, green and blue channels of each pixel by its alpha channel.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the premultiplied image

    • resizeBilinear

      public static int[] resizeBilinear​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, int wTrg, int hTrg)
      Resizes pixels from a source image to a requested size using a bilinear filter. Copies the source to the target if source and target dimensions are equal.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      wTrg - the target width
      hTrg - the target height
      Returns:
      the resized image
      See Also:
      filterBilinear(float, float, int, int, int[])

    • rgb

      public static int[] rgb​(int w, int h, int blue, int[] target)
      Fills the target array with a diagnostic image where the pixel's x coordinate correlates to the red channel; its y coordinate correlates to the green channel. The blue contribution is expected to be in [0, 255].
      Parameters:
      w - the image width
      h - the image height
      blue - the blue amount
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the filled pixels

    • rotate180

      public static int[] rotate180​(int[] source, int[] target)
      Rotates the source pixel array 180 degrees counter-clockwise. The rotation is stored in the target pixel array.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the rotated pixels

    • rotate270

      public static int[] rotate270​(int[] source, int w, int h, int[] target)

      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      w - the image width
      h - the image height
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the rotated pixels

      public static int[] rotate90​(int[] source, int w, int h, int[] target)

    • rotateBilinear

      public static int[] rotateBilinear​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, float cosa, float sina, Vec2 dim)
      Rotates the pixels of a source image around the image center by an angle in radians. Assumes that the sine and cosine of the angle have already been calculated and simple cases (0, 90, 180, 270 degrees) have been filtered out.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      cosa - the cosine of the angle
      sina - the sine of the angle
      dim - the new dimension
      Returns:
      rotated pixels
      See Also:
      filterBilinear(float, float, int, int, int[]), Utils.abs(float)

    • rotateBilinear

      public static int[] rotateBilinear​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, float angle, Vec2 dim)
      Rotates the pixels of a source image around the image center by an angle in radians. Where the angle is approximately 0, 90, 180 and 270 degrees, resorts to faster methods. Uses bilinear filtering.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      angle - the angle in radians
      dim - the new dimension
      Returns:
      rotated pixels
      See Also:
      rotate180(int[], int[]), rotate90(int[], int, int, int[]), rotate270(int[], int, int, int[]), Utils.mod(int, int), Utils.round(float)

    • skewXBilinear

      public static int[] skewXBilinear​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, float angle, Vec2 dim)
      Skews the pixels of a source image horizontally. If the angle is approximately zero, copies the source array. If the angle is approximately IUtils.HALF_PI (1.5707963705062866f, returns an empty array.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      angle - the angle in radians
      dim - the new dimension
      Returns:
      the skewed array
      See Also:
      filterBilinear(float, float, int, int, int[]), Utils.abs(float), Utils.mod(int, int), Utils.round(float)

    • skewYBilinear

      public static int[] skewYBilinear​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, float angle, Vec2 dim)
      Skews the pixels of a source image vertically. If the angle is approximately zero, copies the source array. If the angle is approximately IUtils.HALF_PI (1.5707963705062866f, returns an empty array.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      angle - the angle in radians
      dim - the new dimension
      Returns:
      the skewed array
      See Also:
      filterBilinear(float, float, int, int, int[]), Utils.abs(float), Utils.mod(int, int), Utils.round(float)

    • sRgbaTolRgba

      public static int sRgbaTolRgba​(int c, boolean adjustAlpha)
      Converts a pixel color from standard RGB to linear RGB. If the adjust alpha flag is true, then alpha is converted as well.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      adjustAlpha - adjust alpha flag
      Returns:
      the standard pixels

    • sRgbaTolRgba

      public static int[] sRgbaTolRgba​(int[] source, boolean adjustAlpha, int[] target)
      Converts a source pixel array from standard RGB to linear RGB. If the adjust alpha flag is true, then alpha is converted as well.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      adjustAlpha - adjust alpha flag
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the linear pixels
      See Also:
      sRgbaTolRgba(int, boolean)

    • sRgbLuminance

      public static float sRgbLuminance​(int c)
      Finds the luminance of a color, represented as a 32-bit integer, in standard RGB. Converts the color to linear RGB, then calculates a weighted average.
      Parameters:
      c - color
      Returns:
      the luminance

    • stretchContrast

      public static int[] stretchContrast​(int[] source, float fac, int[] target)
      Finds the minimum, maximum and mean lightness in a source pixels array. If factor is positive, stretches color to maximum lightness range in [0.0, 100.0]. If factor is negative, compresses color to mean. Assigns result to target array. The factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].

      If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      fac - the stretch or compress factor
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the contrast pixels
      See Also:
      Utils.abs(float), Utils.clamp(float, float, float), Color.fromHex(int, Color), Color.sRgbaTolRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.lRgbaToXyza(Color, Vec4), Color.xyzaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.labaToXyza(Vec4, Vec4), Color.xyzaTolRgba(Vec4, Color), Color.lRgbaTosRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.toHexIntSat(Color)

    • tintLab

      public static int[] tintLab​(int[] source, int tint, float fac, int[] target)
      Mixes an image with a color in CIE LAB according to a factor.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      tint - the tint color
      fac - the factor
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the tinted pixels
      See Also:
      Color.fromHex(int, Color), Color.sRgbaTolRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.lRgbaToXyza(Color, Vec4), Color.xyzaToLaba(Vec4, Vec4), Color.labaToXyza(Vec4, Vec4), Color.xyzaTolRgba(Vec4, Color), Color.lRgbaTosRgba(Color, boolean, Color), Color.toHexIntSat(Color)

    • trimAlpha

      public static int[] trimAlpha​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, Vec2 dim)
      Removes excess transparent pixels from an array of pixels. Adapted from the implementation by Oleg Mikhailov: https://stackoverflow.com/a/36938923.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      dim - the new dimension
      Returns:
      the trimmed pixels

    • unpremul

      public static int[] unpremul​(int[] source, int[] target)
      Divides the red, green and blue channels of each pixel in the image by its alpha channel. Reverse pre-multiplication.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the unpremultiplied pixels

    • wrap

      public static int[] wrap​(int[] source, int wSrc, int hSrc, int dx, int dy, int wTrg, int[] target)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - the source pixels
      wSrc - the source image width
      hSrc - the source image height
      dx - the horizontal pixel offset
      dy - the vertical pixel offset
      wTrg - the target image width
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:
      the wrapped pixels
